step1.sentence: He always kept his promises, which was why people trusted him with difficult tasks.

step2.story: She had made a promise to her younger self at sixteen: that she would finish a degree regardless of how long it took. At thirty-four, walking across the stage, she thought about that promise and the twenty years it had taken to keep it.

step3.story: The politician had made many promises during the campaign. Most politicians did. What distinguished her, over time, was a simple habit: she kept a public record of every commitment she had made and updated it quarterly. Citizens could see which promises had been kept, which were in progress, and which had not been started. The transparency invited accountability in a way that press releases never had. She won re-election three times. Opponents noted she had broken three promises in office. She noted publicly that she had kept forty-seven.

meaning.shortExampleEn: She always keeps her promises, no matter how small.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그녀는 크고 작은 약속을 항상 지켜요.
